title: Firefox won't play any videos, anywhere, after update to 85
content:
ETA: I fixed it! I'm an idiot! For anyone else struggling with this...um, quit & restart Firefox. I did a restart after the update, so assumed I didn't need to again? But there you go. Don't be an idiot like me.

Hi. I'm on a Mac 10.12.6. After updating FIrefox to 85 on Jan 31, I can no longer play videos anywhere. Not on Youtube, Vimeo, my own website. The video appears to be loading, but never does. It just spins & spins, or sits there, blank. Buttons work. I can hit 'play' 'pause' and they respond, although it never actually plays. If I hover over the player timeline, I can see upcoming frames. I can play videos on Safari, etc.

I've read articles from Firefox & checking other forum posts, but none seem to fix or even address this specific issue, after the update to 85. I know Firefox removed Flash entirely, but I can't imagine it's that?

Thanks for any insights or ideas!
creator: girlsintheattic

title: NordVPN Account Activation - Checking Browser Error
content: I recently purchased service from NordVPN and ran into an issue activating the new account. After payment, I received an e-mail from NordVPN requesting to click on the "Activate Your Account" button to set a password and activate the account. After doing so, the next window says "please stand by while we check your browser". The next image is an array of nine pictures by which I must identify the boats or bicycles in the photos. After doing so, there is no response for about 10 seconds and the "One More Step" window opens up again with nine new photos. After about 10 sets of photos it becomes obvious there must be an issue. Is this a browser issue?

title: Undo Close Tab doesn't actually undo last tab closed
content:
So, I have a bad habit of keeping pages open in my browser and letting them accumulate in order to read them at a later date. Bad habit, I know. But, when going through and closing old tabs I no longer need, I noticed that the undo close tab button doesn't actually undo the tab you just closed. Instead of re-opening the tab you most recently closed, it re-opens whichever tab you closed recently which most recently *opened*. For example - say I have seven tabs open, with tab one being on the left/opened first, and tab seven being on the right/opened most recently. If I close tab seven and then close tab two, and then I click the undo close tab button, tab seven will be the one to be re-opened, even though it was closed before I closed tab two. Likewise, the tabs on the far left won't show up under recently closed tabs if there are tabs further to the right that were closed, even if they were closed before the tabs on the left.

I discovered this while clearing out tabs I had open. I closed several tabs on the right/most-recent, and then went to the left/oldest tabs and started closing those. I realized after opening a tab that I still kind of needed that page for other things. However, when I went to undo close tab, the tab that opened wasn't the tab I had just closed, it was one of the tabs I had closed several minutes prior that were on the right/most-recent side of the page. The tab which I closed on accident was nowhere to be found in my history.
creator: khandnalie

title: Secure Connection Failed error at google.co.uk
content:
I restarted Firefox to update it and now get this error when I try to access google.co.uk

Secure Connection Failed

An error occurred during a connection to www.google.co.uk. You are attempting to import a cert with the same issuer/serial as an existing cert, but that is not the same cert.

Error code: SEC_ERROR_REUSED_ISSUER_AND_SERIAL 

   The page you are trying to view cannot be shown because the authenticity of the received data could not be verified.    Please contact the web site owners to inform them of this problem.
